page.title: 02Hall Farm/Blaby.
page.content: Mr.& Mrs.{Norman Wells }have been farming at{Hall Farm }for 19 yrs.There are 85 acres in Blaby and 65 acres scattered elsewhere.The land is mostly down to grass for grazing, hay and silage-making.35 acres of barley are grown for cattle-feed. There are 65 milking cows and 63 growing calves.The cows are black and white Fresians,although there is one "red" and white Fresian cow. {Hall Farm}is the only farm left which is actually in the village of{Blaby,} although there are two or three in the parish. Being on the urban fringe presents problems through trespass and vandalism.In 1984 a barn and its hay was lost in a fire- possible cause,a firework.{Mr. and Mrs. Wells}have a son working on the farm who may follow them into the farming business.
